metadata.dc:author: Guajardo, J
Egido, R
Parra, R
Panades, M J
Ramos, J
metadata.dc:description: Renal actinomycosis is rarely suspected and is difficult to diagnose, limited to a few cases in any series. A 56-year-old man with renal actinomycosis and Rendu-Osler disease is described. Long-term therapy with penicillin resulted in a clinical cures. A case report is presented.
metadata.dc:title: Actinomicosis renal: presentaci√≥n de un caso.
[Renal actinomycosis: presentation of a case].
